body: Any update on this?
Hi All, Any plans on this?
Not from my side. Still having the problem with too much rows
@bvpillai please share your solution.

We have created a blank dashboard and placed a tabular element with the help of javascript to load the drill-down data. we used Ag-grid for this. 

In the actual dashboard which is showing all the charts, we have enabled the click event. Then when a user clicked on a chart, through custom Javascript we identified the chart title, id and month, etc. Then pass this to above mentioned blank dashboard's URL as a parameter and open it. In the blank dashboard, with the help of ajax we populate the drill-down data.

If you need more details, please let me know.

I'll probably be adding backend support for pagination to the new `/api/v1/chart/data` endpoint in the coming weeks as part of SIP-38 work. However, I currently can't speak for when support will be added to individual visualizations, as the current SIP-38 effort aims to address some fundamental problems in the current viz architecture. But hopefully these types of features can more easily be added by the community in the future, as the viz plugin development process becomes less technically challenging.

@BigDataArtist 
Well I did find that superset db resides in /home/user/.superset/db

Now I am not working on superset but when I had error I just deleted that db and initialized the db from beginning.
oh! I've been doing it wrong :(

no kerberos. using ldap. i just used sqllab. seems superset is generating those queries itself for things like: data preview, column list/data types, latest partition. standard datasource connecttion was setup beforehand

Thanks willbarret!

I'll join the slack.

Sure, here is the schema I'm running it against:

```
views
date DATE
time TIME WITHOUT TIME ZONE
ip INET
checksum VARCHAR
media VARCHAR
segment VARCHAR
time_taken VARCHAR
ua VARCHAR

mapping
id VARCHAR
title VARCHAR
checksum VARCHAR
```
Query:

```
select
  date
  , count(*)
from
 (select
    distinct
    v.date as date
    , v.ip as ip
  from
    views v)
  as dist_user_asset_date
group by date
order by date asc;
```

This query ran okay in another install of superset, and works fine in the postgres repl.
No further comments from me. I recommend pinging a couple more contributors to review.

In the moment that you add '-' between the numbers it will be considered a String and it will be sorted as String. 

The other option will be to add a '.' instead of '-' so it will still be a number and it will be sorted as such. For example : 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58375897/79410429-653f5180-7f6e-11ea-8122-2e90689ad6ae.png)

Make sense?

I think one of the more fundamental problems here is that `viz.py` is raising `Exception` for all problems, making it very difficult to distinguish between serious and less serious problems. In the interim this is probably a good solution, but going forward I hope we can replace generic Exceptions with more specific ones to distinguish between real serious problems and not so unexpected ones.

I don't have strong feelings about `error`/`payload_error` and `status`/`payload_status`. But my initial feeling is that is the `payload_` prefix adding context that would be lost without it?

I found the solution!

vim /opt/superset-venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/superset/examples/helpers.py
and change the way of urlopen:
 
before change:
    content = request.urlopen(f"{BASE_URL}{filepath}?raw=true").read()

after change:
    import ssl
    context = ssl._create_unverified_context()
    content = request.urlopen(f"{BASE_URL}{filepath}?raw=true", context=context).read()

> Bummer looks like this is unrelated but another issue has come up
> `ERROR: error pulling image configuration: Get https://production.cloudflare.docker.com/registry-v2/docker/registry/v2/blobs/sha256/87/87856cc39862cec77541d68382e4867d7ccb29a85a17221446c857ddaebca916/data?verify=1587082069-3PtcJC%2F8OtRmHd4VA5wMNH2OxnQ%3D: x509: certificate has expired or is not yet valid` This may not be windows specific

It looks like a docker client problem. The issue was discussed as one of the docker's issues here - https://github.com/docker/machine/issues/4046 

Possible solution could be (as suggested in the answers to aforementioned issue - https://github.com/docker/machine/issues/4046)

```bash
docker-machine regenerate-certs --client-certs default
```

You can try to use [Docker Desktop](https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-windows/) or [vagrant](https://www.vagrantup.com/)  + [VirtualBox](https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads) (both will run Apache Superset inside Linux-based system and Windows will be a hosting operation system). There are some issues with this approach, but here you may find more information on how to address them - https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/issues/8632

P.S. Otherwise it could be not that easy task to deploy this solution directly on Windows. You will need to create a proper "virtual environment" with all dependencies and requirements for Python and also for Node.js, install and configure PostgreSQL (I assume), as well as use proper PATH to be able to run everything.

It is most probably an issue with installation of packages for Python on Windows. There are packages that require properly installed *Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2015** (or another version - depends on an official *Visual C++ compiler* for the Python version that is used on your machine). In case of pyarrow according to the documentation [here](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/install.html), you will most probably need to install the *Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2015*. 

A possible workaround (I am not sure if it will work in this particular case with Apache Superset) to use https://www.anaconda.com/distribution/ together with it's conda (instead of pip) for further package installations required for Apache Superset.

Not something directly related to this PR, but [durationFormatter](https://github.com/apache-superset/superset-ui/pull/209) expects parameters as a JSON object. It would be great to have support for specifying custom options for any available formatter in the registry, instead of having to hard code them in `setupFormatters.js`.
